I found some picture and info about the MIR-2 station here: http://nickd.freehostia.com/OrbiterVault/mir2.html

I found some picture and info about the MIR-2 station here: http://nickd.freehostia.com/OrbiterVault/mir2.html

It's a light version of Mir-2, I love the 80s originals better, since even a core module weights the same as the whole Russian segment IRL.

One thing I realized while finishing up the .craft files for the new release is that we have no 1.875 stack engine. I was trying to put together an accurate ASTP .craft, but I couldn't really find a good engine for a 1.875 Apollo made from the VA capsule and the cargo bay.

As it turns out, hoojiwana's MPR-45 from RLA is perfect, it's just too small. That engine in 1.875m would be a perfect Apollo OMS engine. I'll go post in RLA, but I know hooj hangs around here. Is there anyway we could get that engine to TweakScale up to 1.875?

Oh, and Mir .crafts will be dropping as soon as ASTP and ISS modules as finished. Literally have stayed all night tonight finishing the launchers and the descriptions...

Also, as a part of being silly, I made a MM config that uses Adaptive Docking Node to make the non-androgynous ports actually non-androgynous. I only briefly tested it, but it might be of use to someone. Maybe.

Beale, I couldn't see any CLS configs around recently (could have sworn there have been some, but can't see them now). Should the parachute/decoupler and the small docking ports be crew-passable?

Oh god Beale please don't keep me drooling about the R-7 Color scheme No.3! Release them already!

Kraken forgive me for this

Cheers, SpaceEagle
The Gemini looks neat. Odd to think that it'll be larger (wider) than the Soyuz, but I'll take it ;-)

The Gemini looks neat. Odd to think that it'll be larger (wider) than the Soyuz, but I'll take it ;-)

But... it is actually larger, Soyuz capsule is 2.2m wide, Gemini is 3m wide. So, the proportions would be correct.

Are my eyes tricking me? Beale is doing making a historic American spacecraft?

Awesome, i can't wait! Also, we need a Titan II GLV for that Gemini, Gemini-Proton just doesn't feel right.

Edited February 8, 2015 by Sylandro

But... it is actually larger, Soyuz capsule is 2.2m wide, Gemini is 3m wide. So, the proportions would be correct.

Yeah, that's correct. Also, it would be nice replacement for Spica.

Titan II GLV, on the other side, would be kinda hard to replicate without using mods like NovaPunch or KW. Stock 1.25m engines are too weak for LR-87.

Yeah, that's correct. Also, it would be nice replacement for Spica.

Titan II GLV, on the other side, would be kinda hard to replicate without using mods like NovaPunch or KW. Stock 1.25m engines are too weak for LR-87.

SpaceY with its 1.25 400kN engines can be used and it doesn't require much in terms of RAM.

But... it is actually larger, Soyuz capsule is 2.2m wide, Gemini is 3m wide. So, the proportions would be correct.

Yes, but it still seems odd. :-)

That is genius! What solarpanels are those?

FASA Large Station Panels - basically they are skylab side panels. I grabbed FASA just for the launch towers, but when I dug into their files they had both the launch towers and some solar panels in a "MISC" folder - so I just copied the misc folder over and got both the towers/clamps and the panels.

- - - Updated - - -

BUG!

Pavonus Nose cone

Build a ship, launch, revert to launch - now the cone is floating over the rest of the craft.

SpaceY with its 1.25 400kN engines can be used and it doesn't require much in terms of RAM.

Hmm, totally forgot about that one (shame on me, as I have it installed!).

Although, would a 800kN engine suffice for a 2.5m rocket? Anyway, as good old Mordin Solus once said - TESTS!

EDIT: Yeah, you're totally right - here's a nice Titan II GLV, made from stock and SpaceY parts (engines and 2.5-1.25 interstage):

Boilerplate: 6 tons

Engines:

- 1st stage - 2x SpaceY Kiwi, 850 kN

- 2nd stage - 1x SpaceY Kiwi, 425 kN

Mods: FAR, KIDS ("FAR to Stock, atmospheric only" preset)

Achieves 100x100 km orbit with about 1000 m\s dV left.

Anyway - Gemini, I'm ready for ya!

I believe there may be a bug with the new Soyuz parachute

The parachute may need to be resized because I can see the (what you call it? top hatch?). Second, I can't click on the part in the Action Groups editor (other parts work fine, including the new TKS parachute). Third, both the parachute and decoupler don't show up in the staging sequence, which could be disastrous if the Soyuz was crewed.

Anyone else getting this?

FASA Large Station Panels - basically they are skylab side panels. I grabbed FASA just for the launch towers, but when I dug into their files they had both the launch towers and some solar panels in a "MISC" folder - so I just copied the misc folder over and got both the towers/clamps and the panels.

hmm interesting! One can never have to many different solar panels

So is it official then that the Tantini windows are gonna be small and high up?

Also does anyone else think that .6 tons for the vostok decoupler is a bit much? There isn't much reason to use it once you get any other decoupler other than to save you a few 100fund's which is a shame because it makes a spiffy looking 1.25 to .625 adapter for launching tiny probes early game without having to stare at a hollow stock decoupler eyesore.

I believe there may be a bug with the new Soyuz parachute

http://i.imgur.com/iZYKcQo.png

The parachute may need to be resized because I can see the (what you call it? top hatch?). Second, I can't click on the part in the Action Groups editor (other parts work fine, including the new TKS parachute). Third, both the parachute and decoupler don't show up in the staging sequence, which could be disastrous if the Soyuz was crewed.

Anyone else getting this?

From what I can tell, this is a bug with RealChute. It has happened to me before. To fix it, you can just delete the Tantares file in RealChute. The Tantares chutes will be stock, but they will work well enough.

From what I can tell, this is a bug with RealChute. It has happened to me before. To fix it, you can just delete the Tantares file in RealChute. The Tantares chutes will be stock, but they will work well enough.

The name of the cap part changed, causing the entire thing to die horribly, as the RC config refers to that. In RC, under TantaresParachuteA in ModuleManager/Tantares_RealChute_MM.cfg, change the line starting with "capName" to say "capName = Cap". I should report it somewhere or something, or make an MM config that would fix it, but I had a terrible headache most of the day.

EDIT: oh, and the sizing is fine for me, though the nodes are a bit awkwardly close together, causing all sort of funkiness.

EDIT2: also, I have no real idea about RC/chutes in general. It may actually be that cap thingie Jeb wears, not the cap of the chute container. Point is, after that change RC stopped barfing.

Edited February 8, 2015 by ModZero
